title: Update Open Graph metatags to use a blog's excerpt as the description.
body:
With this PR in place, sharing a React blog post on social media will render the blog post excerpt's as part of the share preview, replacing the current generic description.

We also use the correct 'article' value type and update the 'title' accordingly to show "React Blog".
## Test plan

This is an excerpt of the meta tags generated for a [blog post](https://facebook.github.io/react/blog/2016/07/13/mixins-considered-harmful.html):

``` html
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge,chrome=1">
  <title>Mixins Considered Harmful - React Blog</title>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  <meta property="og:title" content="Mixins Considered Harmful - React Blog">
  <meta property="og:type" content="article">
  <meta property="og:url" content="https://facebook.github.io/react/blog/2016/07/13/mixins-considered-harmful.html">
  <meta property="og:image" content="https://facebook.github.io/react/img/logo_og.png">
  <meta property="og:description" content="“How do I share the code between several components?” is one of the first questions that people ask when they learn React. Our answer has always been to use component composition for code reuse. You can define a component and use it in several other components.
">
  <meta property="fb:app_id" content="623268441017527">

  ...

</head>
```

This is an excerpt of the metatags generated for a [documentation page](https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/installation.html):

``` html
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge,chrome=1">
  <title>Installation - React</title>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  <meta property="og:title" content="Installation - React">
  <meta property="og:type" content="website">
  <meta property="og:url" content="https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/installation.html">
  <meta property="og:image" content="https://facebook.github.io/react/img/logo_og.png">
  <meta property="og:description" content="A JavaScript library for building user interfaces">
  <meta property="fb:app_id" content="623268441017527">

  ...

</head>
```
